intro: Pariana paraensis, commonly known as the Amazonian pariana, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom during the wet season. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
